Content.Text:
<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good morning, <MYNAME>. It's Veronica.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm sorry to disturb you this early in the morning.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
However, I come bearing good news.
<PAGE>
Mr. Jonas will fill you in on the details.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, you see, we did an inventory of the shop
stalls we use for trading, and to our surprise, we
found we have an extra stall.
<PAGE>
After discussing it with Miss Veronica, we
decided we'd like you to use it.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
So, how about it? Would you like to run your
own shop? Consider it our thanks for helping
make our town such an attractive trading stop.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, good. There's, um, a lot to explain, so
would you mind coming to the Trade Depot?

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, this will be your shop.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I'm glad you like it.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Okay, let me show you how to use your new
shop.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
And that's about it. I've sent a book on it to your
house, so read it if you get caught up in the
complexities of being a shopkeep.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, we should be getting back to work.
We hope this helps bring even greater prosperity
to your farm.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Anyway, excuse us.

To open your shop, first stand in front of the
signboard and <BLUE>press the A Button</BLUE>.

This will bring up a menu with the following: 
   <BLUE>Open Shop
   Stock Items
   Remove Items
   Empty Register</BLUE>
<PAGE>
If you're opening your shop for the first time,
you should choose <BLUE>Stock Items</BLUE>.

You can choose items to stock from places like
your Bag or your Storage, then choose how
many you want to stock.

After you choose how many to stock, you can
set the price you'd like to sell them at.

You can choose to sell at <BLUE>full</BLUE> or <BLUE>half price</BLUE>.

Once you've set the price, the item will be listed
in your store.

With your items stocked, you'll return to the
first menu. Next, select <BLUE>Open Shop</BLUE>.

You can choose what kind of shop it'll be, like a
"Farmer's Shop," or "Interior Designs." If the type
of shop matches what you have stocked, you
may sell more items.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Once you've opened your shop, you don't need
to stay and watch it. Customers will still come
by and purchase your items.
<PAGE>
And that's how to open a shop.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
When you want to close your shop, look at the
signboard just like you did when you opened the
shop, then select <BLUE>Close Shop</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
Oh, right! Let's not forget about collecting the
profits from what you've sold.
<PAGE>
Profit from your sales is stored at the shop.
When you want to collect that money, choose
<BLUE>Empty Register</BLUE> from the menu.
<PAGE>
The money will automatically be added to your
wallet.
<PAGE>
You can choose Empty Register without having
to close your shop, so there's no harm in
stopping by often to check it.
<BLUE>Opening My Shop</BLUE> was added to my bookshelf.
